full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 755 Filed 08/10/22 Page 165 of 262 1876 LC8VMAX6 Rodgers - cross 1 Q. Now, when the flights were getting ready to taxi and take off, you were usually in the cockpit, right, getting the flight ready? 2 A. That's correct. 3 Q. And you would be in the cockpit generally when the passengers arrived in the plane, right? 4 A. Say that again. 5 Q. You would usually be up in the cockpit getting the plane ready when the passengers arrived for their flights? 6 A. One pilot would usually be in the cockpit, and one would be in the baggage compartment loading luggage. 7 Q. Okay. Well, so if you were in the baggage compartment loading luggage, you'd have the chance to see some of the passengers, right? 8 A. Yes. 9 Q. You might not greet them or meet them, but you'd see them with your eyes? 10 A. Correct. 11 Q. Okay. And even if you were in the cockpit, if you were the pilot that was in the cockpit, the door sometimes was open during the pre-flight preparations? 12 A. Yes, the door is going to be open until the pilot in the back gets through loading the luggage, walks through the compartment, and then the door would be closed. 13 Q. And that's generally the time when the passengers are going SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00019027

1 Q. Now, when the flights were getting ready to taxi and take off, you were usually in the cockpit, right, getting the flight ready? 2 A. That's correct. 3 Q. And you would be in the cockpit generally when the passengers arrived in the plane, right? 4 A. Say that again. 5 Q. You would usually be up in the cockpit getting the plane ready when the passengers arrived for their flights? 6 A. One pilot would usually be in the cockpit, and one would be in the baggage compartment loading luggage. 7 Q. Okay. Well, so if you were in the baggage compartment loading luggage, you'd have the chance to see some of the passengers, right? 8 A. Yes. 9 Q. You might not greet them or meet them, but you'd see them with your eyes? 10 A. Correct. 11 Q. Okay. And even if you were in the cockpit, if you were the pilot that was in the cockpit, the door sometimes was open during the pre-flight preparations? 12 A. Yes, the door is going to be open until the pilot in the back gets through loading the luggage, walks through the compartment, and then the door would be closed. 13 Q. And that's generally the time when the passengers are going
